doc.title: {[project]} User Guide
doc.description: The {[project]} User Guide provides a detailed set of instructions for installing and using {[project]}.

section.title: Introduction
section.p: {[project]} dynamically generates documentation from XML files. Output formats are HTML, PDF and markdown.
This guide is in XML and is generated by {[project]}

section.title: Usage Overview
section.p: {[project]} uses XML files as the basis for the documentation to be generated. A minimum of two files are needed:

list.list-item: A manifest that defines the documents to load and render.
Source file(s) that are the documents themselves.

section.title: Manifest File
section.p: The manifest.xml file is required to exist in the doc directory; it defines the documents to load and render. System wide variables are also declared by using the <variable> tag. A variable can then be referenced in the manifest or source xml files by enclosing it in curly braces and square braces (i.e. {[myvar]}).

section.title: Source File
section.p: Source XML files to render must be located in the doc/xml directory. A source file contains the XML to display and execute.
